intro: Hieracium pojoritense subsp. pojoritense, commonly known as the Pojoritense hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped with hairy surfaces, and it is often found in low-lying areas with well-drained soil.
